post.author: jacks
post.title: Tim Denison's Graduate Success Story!
post.description: I had worked for 6 years as a struggling artist, but needed to move on from dreams of success [more]
post.content:
I had worked for 6 years as a struggling artist, but needed to move on from dreams of success [more] in that arena so that I could better take care of my family. I was in a tough situation of having been self employed as an artist for so long that my previous career experience was in the too-distant past to really be relevant in my new job search. 


I knew that I needed something that engaged my intellect and love of problem solving, had a high demand for workers, paid well, and could be accessed without spending 50K+ dollars and 2-4 more years in college.

When I started considering software development, I knew that I had found something that hit three of those four requirements. But how to break into that industry without taking 24+ months to do it?

The Tech Academy prepared me to do just that in only 5 months. I started classes in mid-March and had a new career, with decent pay and benefits, on the 1st of August. 

It is absolutely doable. This is something that can happen. It doesn't happen by itself. You are as successful as you determine yourself to be through commitment and effort. But if you go all in, The Tech Academy has the resources to help prepare you for an exciting new career.

I'm extremely grateful for my experience at The Tech Academy of Portland.
